content.question: After the First World War, it was difficult to write a peace treaty according to Woodrow Wilson's Fourteen Points primarily because

choices.label: the Great Depression caused the Allies to insist on reparations
the Allies had secret treaties that conflicted with the Fourteen Points
Germany would not accept the Fourteen Points
Wilson had disavowed the Fourteen Points after Germany resumed unrestricted submarine warfare
Wilson and his Fourteen Points were largely unknown in Europe

content.answer: the Allies had secret treaties that conflicted with the Fourteen Points

topic.text: 8.11: Continuity and Changes in an Age of Global Conflict

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
